newsitem.title: USA: US late spot propane narrowly mixed in scant trade.
newsitem.headline: US late spot propane narrowly mixed in scant trade.

text.p: U.S. spot propane prices sagged in midday trade Monday, players said, with very little activity ahead of the Christmas holiday on Wednesday.
Spot propane in the Midwest trading hub of Conway, Kansas, was talked between 88.00 cents and 93.00 cents a gallon, about three cents less than Friday.
Buyers and sellers were far apart amid lack of demand, and some buyers were heard at 67.00 cents.
Prices fell four cents in the Gulf Coast, meanwhile, where Mont Belvieu propane was traded at 59.50 cents although few deals were seen.
- Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk, 212 859-1631
